title: K-Star Commercial Loan Transaction Manager
content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. REAL ESTATE CREDIT OVERVIEW
KKR’s Real Estate Credit platform was formed in January 2015 to invest in real estate credit products and complement KKR’s Real Estate private equity business. Within KKR Real Estate Credit, we seek opportunities where we have a sourcing, underwriting or execution advantage by leveraging KKR’s brand, industry knowledge and relationships. KKR Real Estate Credit currently invests through seven separately capitalized vehicles across our Direct Lending and Securities portfolios and consists of 50+ dedicated professionals based in New York, Dallas, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Houston and London.
KKR has developed a dedicated services platform, K-Star Asset Management LLC (“K-Star”), to support asset management, loan origination, securities investing, risk management and client experience for its real estate credit franchise as it continues to scale. The K-Star team includes industry specialists to oversee special servicing, stabilized loan asset management, transitional loan asset management, due diligence, investment closing and oversight across KKR’s real estate credit portfolio. 
POSITION OVERVIEW
K-Star is seeking an enthusiastic, intelligent, and diligent individual to work in close coordination with the KKR originations team, KKR and K-Star Asset Management teams, operations, and outside and in-house counsel to support the entire commercial loan closing process. The individual will be responsible for coordinating and managing deal kick-off and closing timeline, monitoring the Know Your Process (“KYC”), gathering and managing requisite documents and confirming their accuracy, assisting with investment committee memoranda, leading the post-closing transition of loans from KKR originations to K-Star Asset Management and managing any other post-closing documentation required. 
This candidate must have prior commercial real estate loan closing experience, multifamily, office, and hospitality at a minimum. This individual must be a critical thinker who is highly organized, a strong communicator, and have the ability to build strong partnerships across the various KKR businesses and stakeholders, including the firm’s originations, legal, operations and asset management and special servicing teams.
ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Coordinate and assist the KKR originations team with the commercial loan closing process and provide originations process insight to the asset management teams in connection with future performing loan consent matters
Coordinate deal kickoff and assist KKR originations team with drafting and distribution of underwriting checklist and liaise with outside counsel regarding legal checklist
Coordinate and monitor KYC process, with special attention to analyzing complex borrowing entity structures
Manage third-party vendors, including appraisals, ESAs, PCRs, seismic and construction, and zoning reports
Prepare KKR settlement statement and collect third-party invoices in coordination with KKR originations team
Maintain alignment amongst the KKR originations team, borrowers, brokers, and legal counsel through regular updates and correspondence
Lead the post-closing transition of loans from KKR originations to K-Star asset management and special servicing teams
Ensure all required documents are received by appropriate document custodian and delivery of original letters of credit to responsible custodian
Assist asset managers in drafting and negotiating certain post-closing documents, including NDAs, reservation of rights letters, and other loan correspondence

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience preferably in a related course of study
At least ten (10) years of experience with commercial real estate finance products and commercial mortgage loans required (multifamily, office, and hospitality at a minimum)
Significant commercial loan experience in a comparable role at a nationally recognized asset management, servicer, relevant public company or law firm
Superior analytical, quantitative, communication, interpersonal and problem solving skills
High proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Self-starter with strong drive and initiative and a willingness to take on additional responsibilities, as needed
Goal-orientation and the ability to effectively multi-task, prioritize, and manage timelines
High level of integrity and the ability to identify and escalate issues related to risk and compliance
Team player with collaborative and strong relationship building skills, who is also able to work independently and represent the Firm’s culture and values in a professional manner

 
#LI-OnsiteKKR is an equal opportunity employer.  Individuals seeking employment are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by applicable law.
